abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Protection Project responds
            directly to the Country Assistance Strategy (CAS) pillar of
            "sharing the fruits of growth". The project
            objective would be to support the design and development of
            a social protection system by co-financing the Familias
            Conditional Cash Transfers Program, expanding it to new
            areas, and developing it further to become a crisis response
            instrument, and, strengthening the Ministry of Social
            Protection (MSP) to improve the basic architecture of the
            social protection system, in addition to improving the
            monitoring and evaluation capacity of the MSP, as part of a
            broader Government effort. In line with the country's
            legislation, and the Bank's social safeguards, this
            Indigenous Peoples Plan (IPP) identifies issues, to ensure
            indigenous peoples, and ethnic minorities, are included in
            sharing the benefits of project implementation, and in
            addition, that their rights are respected, including their
            cultural identity. The following actions are included in the
            plan which has been agreed upon with the Colombian
            authorities: development of a program strategy study on
            ethnic populations, with special focus on the program's
            promotion activities; training for municipal staff (enlaces
            municipales) to be more aware of the ethnic
            population's specific characteristics. and their own
            behaviors toward this population group; Promotion of a more
            cooperative program with health facilities, particularly in
            the program's training activities (encuentros de
            cuidado); Further data collection and analysis should be
            gathered to better understand some of the problems
            identified by the social assessment, while an action plan
            will be formulated to address issues; Inclusion of
            information on ethnicity in the impact surveys.
